meanings.definition: To come into conflict or disagreement
meanings.sent1: The two friends were clashing over which movie to watch.
meanings.sent2: The siblings were always clashing about cleaning their room.
meanings.sent3: The cats were clashing over who gets to sit on the sunny spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: The waves were clashing against the rocks, creating a beautiful spray of water.
meanings.sent5: The political parties were clashing fiercely during the debate.

meanings.sent1: The clashing of cymbals signaled the start of the performance.
meanings.sent2: The clashing of pots and pans in the kitchen woke up the entire house.
meanings.sent3: The clashing of swords in the movie made the fight scene intense.
meanings.sent4: The clashing of thunder echoed through the valley during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The clashing of metal chains could be heard from afar.

meanings.sent1: The clashing between the two teams led to a heated argument.
meanings.sent2: The clashing between the neighbors over the property line escalated quickly.
meanings.sent3: The clashing of opinions in the meeting made it hard to reach a decision.
meanings.sent4: The clashing of personalities in the group project caused tension.
meanings.sent5: The clashing of interests between the siblings resulted in a compromise.
